reviews.review: Funny, emotional, and action packed. I’ve never seen a more stunned audience for a Marvel film.

Hard to judge without its "ending"   but if you are a fan of the earlier movies you will love it.   Public Service announcement if you talk during this movie or use your phone you deserve to have you ass kicked. (had the misfortune of seeing this in Dallas where apparently everyone was raised by internet trolls)

Dissatisfying ending, left on a sour note. A movie full of failures, some of which felt like the characters didn't really try, without any real movements of heroic hope and a knowledge that they're just going to cheapen it by reversing everything in the next one. Quietest I've ever heard an audience on an opening night marvel showing.

No spoilers of course but everyone needs to see avengers:infinity war. It blew past all expectations and was the best avengers to date. Not at all predictable, funny, and on another lvl. Kudos to marvel and the Russo brothers for pulling off the impossible. 35 main characters and not one wasted... now to wait till part 2
IT’S SO INCREDIBLE!! There’s a lot going on but they’ve done such an amazing job. My heart still hurts from certain things that took place but I am so ready for part 2. Why is 2019 so far away?!
Amazing movie, from the first arc to the ever-expanding story, you can never take your eyes of the screen for more than a millisecond, the action is plenty and the jokes come on the right times,

Avengers Infinity War is the best Marvel movie I've seen.
Excellent plot, special effects and great performances by all the actors. ????????

Greetings from Argentina.???????

This movie was phenomenal! Such an excellent balance of screen time for each character. The dynamics of each team up worked really well especially given that a good portion of the film follows characters from wildly different aspects of this universe working together.  Brolin's performance as Thanos was excellent. Be patient with his character because by the end of the film, his character is very well developed. He is a very complex antagonist who's convictions, more than his titanic powers, make him rather terrifying.  Furthermore, even if you have some knowledge of the comicbook arcs this film is based on and therefore have a general idea of how it might end, you will still be surprised. A few great twists and interesting choice that the Russo's made have this movie feeling like the freshest, most exciting marvel film yet.  Don't pay attention to the critics saying the film missed its mark. They're saying that there are too many characters and that there's no real ending. To then I say, what did you expect? If you've been following the development of this universe for the last ten years, keeping in mind that Avengers 4 (slated for release of May 2019) is essentially a direct sequel to Infiniy War, then you'll find that this movie is exactly what it needed to be. Real stakes, dire consequences, and a rich emotional toll taken by the end of the film. Great quips and comedy in there per usual as well, but not over bearing like Age of Ultron, GotG Vol. 2, or Ragnarok (which was intentionally a comedy). To summarize, the movie is fantastic and every audience member, whether old or new, into the comics or not, will enjoy this movie. 

P.S. Stay tuned for the post credits scene at the end! It topped off the end of the film I a great way!
